sen.j: 祭政分離のため、惣領は兄の信満が継ぎ、大祝は頼満が継承した。
sen.e: To separate church and state, Nobumitsu, the older brother became the soryo (heir) and Yorimitsu became the ohori.
To separate church and state, Nobumitsu, the older brother became the soryo (heir) and Yorimitsu became the ohori.
To separate church and state, Nobumitsu, the older brother became the soryo (heir) and Yorimitsu became the ohori.

sen.j: このため諏訪氏は分裂し、頼満は惣領の信満としばしば対立した。
sen.e: This caused factionalization of Suwa clan and Yorimitsu was often opposed to the soryo, Nobumitsu.
This caused factionalization of the Suwa clan and Yorimitsu was often opposed to the soryo, Nobumitsu.

sen.j: この対立はそれぞれの子の諏訪政満（惣領家）と諏訪継満（大祝家）との代にも継続し、ついに文明15年に、継満は金刺氏や高遠氏と組んで政満らを謀殺する（文明の内訌）。
sen.e: The confrontation lasted into the generation of Masamitsu SUWA (the soryo family) and 継満 (the ohori family), finally 1483, cooperated with Kanasashi clan and Takato clan 継満 murdered Masamitsu and his subordinates (Bunmei no Naiko, internal strife in Bunmei era).

The confrontation lasted into the generation of Masamitsu SUWA (the soryo family) and Tsugumitsu (継満) (the ohori family), finally in 1483, in cooperation with the Kanasashi clan and the Takato clan Tsugumitsu (継満) murdered Masamitsu and his subordinates (Bunmei no Naiko, the internal strife in the Bunmei era).
sen.cmt: Tsugumitsu (継満)、the Kanasashi clan、the Takato clan、the internal strife in the Bunmei eraとし、1483→in 1483、cooperated with→in cooperation withに修正しました。
sen.e: The confrontation lasted into the generation of Masamitsu SUWA (the soryo family) and Tsugumitsu (継満) (the ohori family), finally in 1483, in cooperation with the Kanasashi clan and the Takato clan Tsugumitsu (継満) murdered Masamitsu and his subordinates (Bunmei no Naiko, the internal strife in the Bunmei era).

sen.j: しかし、惣領家の家臣の反撃に遭い、継満は伊那に逃亡する。
sen.e: However retainers of the soryo family counterattacked 継満 and he fled to Ina-gun Country.
However retainers of the soryo family counterattacked Tsugumitsu (継満) and he fled to Ina County.
sen.cmt: Tsugumitsu (継満)とし、Ina-gun Country→Ina Countyに修正しました。
sen.e: However retainers of the soryo family counterattacked Tsugumitsu (継満) and he fled to Ina County.

sen.j: この混乱の中、隠居の頼満は病床にあったため逃げ切れず討ち取られている。
sen.e: In the confusion, Yorimitsu already retired at that time, was killed because he was ill in bed and not able to escape.
In the confusion, Yorimitsu, who already retired at that time, was killed because he was ill in bed and not able to escape.
sen.cmt: Yorimitsu already retired at that time, was killed→Yorimitsu, who already retired at that time, was killedとしました。
sen.e: In the confusion, Yorimitsu, who already retired at that time, was killed because he was ill in bed and not able to escape.

sen.e: Yorimitsu SUWA (December 9, 1473-January 17, 1540) was a busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku Period.
Yorimitsu SUWA (1473-January 27, 1540) was a busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku period.

sen.e: Yorimitsu SUWA (1473-January 27, 1540) was a busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku period.

sen.cmt: the Suwa clan、family→a familyとし、「戦国大名」の表記を修正しました。
sen.e: He was the family head of the Suwa clan, a family of Sengoku daimyo (Japanese territorial lord in the Sengoku period) in Sinano Province.

sen.e: He was a son of Masamitsu SUWA and grand father of Yorishige SUWA (in Sengoku Period).
He was a son of Masamitsu SUWA and grand father of Yorishige SUWA (in the Sengoku period).

sen.j: 文明15年1月8日_(旧暦)、一族の諏訪継満（大祝家）・金刺興春（諏訪下社金刺氏）・高遠継宗（高遠氏）の反乱（文明の内訌）によって父政満と兄を殺されたため10歳で家督を相続した。
sen.e: In 1483, 継満 SUWA in Suwa clan (the ohori family), Okiharu Kanasashi (Suwa shimosha Kanasashi clan) and TAKATO 継宗 (Takato clan) carried out a revolt (Bunmei no Naiko) and because Masamitsu, Yorimitsu's father and older brother were killed, Yorimitsu took over as head of the family.
sen.cmt: 読み方不明です：継宗 Tsugumune?
sen.e: On February 24, 1483, Tsugumitsu (継満) SUWA from the Suwa clan (the ohori family), Okiharu KANASASHI (the Suwa shimosha Kanasashi clan) and Tsugumune (継宗) TAKATO (the Takato clan) carried out a revolt (Bunmei no Naiko) and because Masamitsu, Yorimitsu's father and older brother were killed, Yorimitsu took over as head of the family at the age of 10.
sen.cmt: 「1月8日_(旧暦)」「10歳で」→訳漏れのため訳出、in Suwa clan→from the Suwa clan、継満→Tsugumitsu (継満)、Okiharu Kanasashi→Okiharu KANASASHI、the Suwa shimosha Kanasashi clan、TAKATO 継宗→Tsugumune (継宗) TAKATO、the Takato clanとしました。
sen.e: On February 24, 1483, Tsugumitsu (継満) SUWA from the Suwa clan (the ohori family), Okiharu KANASASHI (the Suwa shimosha Kanasashi clan) and Tsugumune (継宗) TAKATO (the Takato clan) carried out a revolt (Bunmei no Naiko) and because Masamitsu, Yorimitsu's father and older brother were killed, Yorimitsu took over as head of the family at the age of 10.

sen.j: 成長すると金刺興春の子・金刺昌春を甲斐国に追放し、高遠継宗の子・高遠頼継を降伏させて諏訪郡一帯を統一し、さらに昌春を助ける甲斐の武田信虎とも戦う。
sen.e: After he grow up, he exiled Masaharu KANASASHI, a son of Okiharu KANASASHI to Kai Province and forced Yoritsugu TAKATO, a son of 継宗 TAKATO to surrender, so he unified Suwa-gun Country area and fought against Nobutora TAKEDA who helped Masaharu.

After he grow up, he exiled Masaharu KANASASHI, a son of Okiharu KANASASHI to Kai Province and forced Yoritsugu TAKATO, a son of Tsugumune (継宗) TAKATO to surrender, so he unified Suwa County area and fought against Nobutora TAKEDA in Kai who helped Masaharu.
sen.cmt: 「甲斐の」→訳漏れのため訳出、継宗→Tsugumune (継宗)、Suwa-gun Country→Suwa Countyに修正
sen.e: After he grow up, he exiled Masaharu KANASASHI, a son of Okiharu KANASASHI to Kai Province and forced Yoritsugu TAKATO, a son of Tsugumune (継宗) TAKATO to surrender, so he unified Suwa County area and fought against Nobutora TAKEDA in Kai who helped Masaharu.

sen.j: 享禄元年（1528年）には国境の神戸境川（長野県諏訪郡富士見町）において信虎勢を撃破し、積極的に領国を拡大していった。
sen.e: In 1528, he smashed Nobutora force at Godo and Sakai-gawa River on a frontier (present-day Hujimi-cho Suwa-gun Nagano Prefecture) and actively expanded his territory.
In 1528, he smashed the Nobutora force at Sakai-gawa River, Godo on a frontier (present-day Fujimi-cho, Suwa County, Nagano Prefecture) and actively expanded his territory.
sen.cmt: the Nobutora forceとし、Godo and Sakai-gawa River→Sakai-gawa River, Godo、Hujimi-cho Suwa-gun→Fujimi-cho Suwa Countyに修正、カンマ追加しました。
sen.e: In 1528, he smashed the Nobutora force at Sakai-gawa River, Godo on a frontier (present-day Fujimi-cho, Suwa County, Nagano Prefecture) and actively expanded his territory.

sen.j: このように諏訪氏の最盛期を築き上げた頼満は、『諏訪氏中興の祖』と言われた。
sen.e: He was called "Chuko no So"(the founder of a renaissance) of Suwa clan because Suwa clan had the most prosperous time under his leadership.
He was called "Chuko no So"(the founder of a renaissance) of the Suwa clan because the Suwa clan had the most prosperous time under his leadership.

sen.j: 享禄3年（1530年）4月18日 (旧暦)、嫡男諏訪頼隆が頼満に先立って31歳で急死、天文3年には嫡孫の諏訪頼重 (戦国時代)に家督を譲って出家して碧雲斎と名乗る。
sen.e: In April 18, 1530, his legitimate son Yoritaka suddenly passed away at the age of 31 and in 1534, he transferred the head of the family to his legitimate grandchild, entered into priest hood and called himself as Hekiunsai.

On May 25, 1530, his legitimate son Yoritaka suddenly passed away earlier than Yorimitsu at the age of 31 and in 1534, he transferred the head of the family to his legitimate grandchild Yorishige SUWA (the Sengoku period), entered into priesthood and called himself Hekiunsai.
sen.cmt: 「頼満に先立って」「諏訪頼重 (戦国時代)」→訳漏れのため訳出、In→On、旧暦→新暦に修正、priest hood→priesthood、called himself as Hekiunsai→called himself Hekiunsaiに修正しました。
sen.e: On May 25, 1530, his legitimate son Yoritaka suddenly passed away earlier than Yorimitsu at the age of 31 and in 1534, he transferred the head of the family to his legitimate grandchild Yorishige SUWA (the Sengoku period), entered into priesthood and called himself Hekiunsai.

sen.j: 享禄4年（1531年）には甲斐の国人領主らを後援した河原辺合戦（山梨県韮崎市）で敗退しており、天文4年（1535年）には信虎と和睦する。
sen.e: In 1531, he supported kokujin ryoshu (local samurai lord) in Kai Province but lost the Kawarabe battle and made peace with Nobutora in 1535.
In 1531, he supported kokujin ryoshu (local samurai lord) in Kai Province but lost the Kawarabe Battle (Nirasaki City, Yamanashi Prefecture) and made peace with Nobutora in 1535.
sen.cmt: （山梨県韮崎市）→訳漏れのため訳出、the Kawarabe Battleとしました。
sen.e: In 1531, he supported kokujin ryoshu (local samurai lord) in Kai Province but lost the Kawarabe Battle (Nirasaki City, Yamanashi Prefecture) and made peace with Nobutora in 1535.

sen.j: 信虎の娘を頼重に娶わせてともに小笠原長棟を攻めたが、背中に出来た腫瘍の悪化によって67歳で病死した。
sen.e: He let Yorishige marry the daughter of Nobutora and attacked Nagamune OGASAWARA together, however he died of illness at the age of 67 because a tumor on his back became worse.
